title: Chef
data:
The **Chef** is a [role](/wiki/Role "Role") that appears in [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"). They are primarily a melee-based role and have many food-related abilities.

A Chef starts the game with equipment and abilities related to food and culinary skills. Chefs are the only role that can make non-homemade tins. In addition, Chefs have permanent food appraisal.

The [Chef quest](/wiki/Chef_quest "Chef quest") sees you fighting the [Immortal Rot](/index.php?title=Immortal_Rot\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Immortal Rot (page does not exist)") for the [The Deluxe Yendorian Knife](/index.php?title=The_Deluxe_Yendorian_Knife\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "The Deluxe Yendorian Knife (page does not exist)").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Starting Equipment](#Starting_Equipment)
- [2 Techniques](#Techniques)
- [3 Intrinsics](#Intrinsics)
- [4 Skills](#Skills)
- [5 Gods](#Gods)
- [6 Chef rank titles](#Chef_rank_titles)
- [7 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [8 Origin](#Origin)
- [9 References](#References)

## Starting Equipment

- a blessed +1 knife
- blessed +1 leather armor
- a blessed +2 dented pot
- 3 food rations
- a sprig of wolfsbane
- a clove of garlic
- 2 uncursed potions of water
- 2 potions of booze
- a can of grease
- a towel
- a blessed tinning kit
- a tin opener

## Techniques

Chefs do not gain any intrinsic techniques.

## Intrinsics

- XL 7: [Poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance")
- XL 15: [Fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance")

## Skills

| Chef skills |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ----------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Max         | Skills                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| Basic       | - *Weapons:* [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword"), [flail](/wiki/Flail "Flail"), [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber"), [sling](/wiki/Sling "Sling"), [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn")
- *Spells:* [protection](/wiki/Protection_spells "Protection spells")                                                                                                                                 |
| Skilled     | * *Weapons:* [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"), [club](/wiki/Club "Club"), [paddle](/wiki/Paddle "Paddle"), [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword"), [quarterstaff](/wiki/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff")
* *Combat:* [bare hands](/wiki/Bare_hands "Bare hands"), [two weapon combat](/wiki/Two_weapon_combat "Two weapon combat")
* *Spells:* [divination](/wiki/Divination_spells "Divination spells") |
| Expert      | - *Weapons:* [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife"), [dart](/wiki/Dart "Dart"), [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe"), [hammer](/wiki/Hammer "Hammer")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |

## Gods

- *Main article: [Religion](/wiki/Religion "Religion")*

* Lawful: Demeter
* Neutral: Hestia
* Chaotic: Adephagia

## Chef rank titles

The [status line](/wiki/Status_line "Status line") shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified experience level:

- XL 1-2: Plongeur
- XL 3-5: Busser
- XL 6-9: Expediter
- XL 10-13: Apprenti
- XL 14-17: Commis
- XL 18-21: Cuisinier
- XL 22-25: Chef de Partie
- XL 26-29: Sous Chef
- XL 30: Chef de Cuisine

## Strategy

While Chefs have a few solid starting items, their +1 [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife") is not going to be dealing much damage much like a [healer](/wiki/Healer "Healer"). Chefs will want to sacrifice for their guaranteed gift [Tenderizer](/index.php?title=Tenderizer\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Tenderizer (page does not exist)") as soon as possible, a respectable weapon that could carry them through to the midgame. Before that, however, it may be worthwhile to train [daggers](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") or perhaps even [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword"). Though it is harder to make use of them in the early game, almost all Chefs will eventually want to train [knives](/wiki/Knives "Knives") due to their quest artifact [The Deluxe Yendorian Knife](/index.php?title=The_Deluxe_Yendorian_Knife\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "The Deluxe Yendorian Knife (page does not exist)") yielding a whopping +20 damage in addition to its other strong attributes. The Chef's power scales significantly as the game progresses, in large part due to this powerful weapon. Their skill in two-weapon combat makes them a good candidate for dual-wield multiple artifact weapons.

## Origin

Chef entirely replaced the previous Elph role.

## References

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Chef

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The Chef is a role that appears in SlashTHEM. They are primarily a melee-based role and have many food-related abilities.

A Chef starts the game with equipment and abilities related to food and culinary skills. Chefs are the only role that can make non-homemade tins. In addition, Chefs have permanent food appraisal.

The Chef quest sees you fighting the Immortal Rot for the The Deluxe Yendorian Knife.

Contents

  • 1 Starting Equipment
  • 2 Techniques
  • 3 Intrinsics
  • 4 Skills
  • 5 Gods
  • 6 Chef rank titles
  • 7 Strategy
  • 8 Origin
  • 9 References

Starting Equipment

  • a blessed +1 knife
  • blessed +1 leather armor
  • a blessed +2 dented pot
  • 3 food rations
  • a sprig of wolfsbane
  • a clove of garlic
  • 2 uncursed potions of water
  • 2 potions of booze
  • a can of grease
  • a towel
  • a blessed tinning kit
  • a tin opener

Techniques

Chefs do not gain any intrinsic techniques.

Intrinsics

  • XL 7: Poison resistance
  • XL 15: Fire resistance

Skills

Chef skills
Max Skills
Basic
  • Weapons: long sword, flail, saber, sling, unicorn horn
  • Spells: protection
Skilled
  • Weapons: dagger, club, paddle, short sword, quarterstaff
  • Combat: bare hands, two weapon combat
  • Spells: divination
Expert
  • Weapons: knife, dart, axe, hammer


Gods

Main article: Religion
  • Lawful: Demeter
  • Neutral: Hestia
  • Chaotic: Adephagia

Chef rank titles

The status line shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified experience level:

  • XL 1-2: Plongeur
  • XL 3-5: Busser
  • XL 6-9: Expediter
  • XL 10-13: Apprenti
  • XL 14-17: Commis
  • XL 18-21: Cuisinier
  • XL 22-25: Chef de Partie
  • XL 26-29: Sous Chef
  • XL 30: Chef de Cuisine

Strategy

While Chefs have a few solid starting items, their +1 knife is not going to be dealing much damage much like a healer. Chefs will want to sacrifice for their guaranteed gift Tenderizer as soon as possible, a respectable weapon that could carry them through to the midgame. Before that, however, it may be worthwhile to train daggers or perhaps even short sword. Though it is harder to make use of them in the early game, almost all Chefs will eventually want to train knives due to their quest artifact The Deluxe Yendorian Knife yielding a whopping +20 damage in addition to its other strong attributes. The Chef's power scales significantly as the game progresses, in large part due to this powerful weapon. Their skill in two-weapon combat makes them a good candidate for dual-wield multiple artifact weapons.

Origin

Chef entirely replaced the previous Elph role.

References


Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Chef&oldid=157413"

The '''Chef''' is a [[role]] that appears in [[SlashTHEM]]. They are primarily a melee-based role and have many food-related abilities.

A Chef starts the game with equipment and abilities related to food and culinary skills. Chefs are the only role that can make non-homemade tins. In addition, Chefs have permanent food appraisal.

The [[Chef quest]] sees you fighting the [[Immortal Rot]] for the [[The Deluxe Yendorian Knife]].

==Starting Equipment==

* a blessed +1 knife
* blessed +1 leather armor
* a blessed +2 dented pot
* 3 food rations
* a sprig of wolfsbane
* a clove of garlic
* 2 uncursed potions of water
* 2 potions of booze
* a can of grease
* a towel
* a blessed tinning kit
* a tin opener

== Techniques ==

Chefs do not gain any intrinsic techniques.

==Intrinsics==
*XL 7: [[Poison resistance]]
*XL 15: [[Fire resistance]]

==Gods==

==Chef rank titles==

The [[status line]] shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified experience level:

*XL 1-2: Plongeur
*XL 3-5: Busser
*XL 6-9: Expediter
*XL 10-13: Apprenti
*XL 14-17: Commis
*XL 18-21: Cuisinier
*XL 22-25: Chef de Partie
*XL 26-29: Sous Chef
*XL 30: Chef de Cuisine

==Strategy==
While Chefs have a few solid starting items, their +1 [[knife]] is not going to be dealing much damage much like a [[healer]]. Chefs will want to sacrifice for their guaranteed gift [[Tenderizer]] as soon as possible, a respectable weapon that could carry them through to the midgame. Before that, however, it may be worthwhile to train [[dagger]]s or perhaps even [[short sword]]. Though it is harder to make use of them in the early game, almost all Chefs will eventually want to train [[knives]] due to their quest artifact [[The Deluxe Yendorian Knife]] yielding a whopping +20 damage in addition to its other strong attributes. The Chef's power scales significantly as the game progresses, in large part due to this powerful weapon. Their skill in two-weapon combat makes them a good candidate for dual-wield multiple artifact weapons.

==Origin==
Chef entirely replaced the previous Elph role.
